vidis.util.graphs.graph.algorithm
Class ShortestPathAlgorithm

java.lang.Object
  vidis.util.graphs.graph.algorithm.ShortestPathAlgorithm
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
ShortestPathAlgorithmDijkstra, ShortestPathAlgorithmMooreFord
public abstract class ShortestPathAlgorithm
extends Object
implements Serializable

Abstract class for implementing the shortest path algorithm. A shortest path spanning tree is a subgraph of the original weighted graph showing how to reach all other vertices from a given vertex in the same connected set in the shortest possible way. The shortest path between two vertices should be such that the sum of the weights of all the edges between the two vertices be at a minimum. Note that, like minimum spanning trees, there may be more than one shortest spanning tree for a single weighted graph. Concrete subclasses must never modify the weighted graph where it is computing the shortest path.

Version:
1.0 2002-10-20
Author:
Jesus M. Salvo Jr., Ralf Vandenhouten
See Also:

Field Detail

wgraph

WeightedGraph wgraph
The WeightedGraph object that the algorithm uses to determine the shortest path spanning tree. Concrete subclasses must implement wgraph as a directed (!) WeightedGraph.

startVertex

Vertex startVertex
Start vertex of the shortest path tree.

shortestpathtree

WeightedGraph shortestpathtree
The WeightedGraph that represents the shortest path spanning tree.

Method Detail

shortestPath

public WeightedGraph shortestPath(Vertex from)
Wrapper method that sets the start vertex and calls shortestPath() for computing the shortest path spanning tree.

Parameters:
from - The root vertex of the shortest path spanning tree.
Returns:
A new WeightedGraph that represents the shortest path spanning tree of the original WeightedGraph.

shortestPath

public abstract WeightedGraph shortestPath()
Abstract method to be implemented by subclasses to determine a shortest path spanning tree from a given vertex in the form of a graph.

Returns:
A new WeightedGraph that represents the shortest path spanning tree of the original WeightedGraph. Do not modify the contents of the returned WeightedGraph.

getShortestPath

public List<Vertex> getShortestPath(Vertex v1,
                                    Vertex v2)
This method returns the shortest path between two vertices as a list of the vertices the path consists of.

Parameters:
v1 - The start vertex of the path
v2 - The target vertex of the path
Returns:
The List object containing the vertices of the path.

getDistance

public double getDistance(Vertex v1,
                          Vertex v2)
Compute the distance between two vertices in the shortest path spanning tree.

Parameters:
v1 - The start vertex
v2 - The target vertex
Returns:
The distance between v1 and v2 in the shortest path spanning tree if v2 is reachable from v1, otherwise Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY is returned.

getDistanceInTree

public double getDistanceInTree(Vertex v1,
                                Vertex v2)
Recursive method used by getDistance(v1,v2) for finding partial distances of two vertices in the shortest path spanning tree.

Parameters:
v1 - The start vertex
v2 - The target vertex
Returns:
The distance between v1 and v2, if v2 is a successor of v1, otherwise Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY is returned.

getLongestDistance

public double getLongestDistance(Vertex v1)
Method that computes the longest distance of any vertex from the start vertex of the shortest path spanning tree.

Parameters:
v1 - The start vertex
Returns:
The longest distance between v1 and any other vertex in the shortest path spanning tree.

getLongestDistanceInTree

public double getLongestDistanceInTree(Vertex v1)
Recursive method used by getLongestDistance(v1) for finding the longest distance of the subtree starting at vertex v1

Parameters:
v1 - The root vertex of the subtree considered.
Returns:
The longest distance between v1 any other vertex in the subtree of v1.

getRoutingTable

public Map getRoutingTable(Vertex v)
Method that computes the routing table corresponding to a shortest path spanning tree as a map of target vertices to neighbor vertices.

Parameters:
v - The node of which the routing table is of interest.
Returns:
A Map object that maps a target vertex of the spanning tree to the neighboring node of the vertex v that is used for routing to this target.
